'''Vernon Oxford''' (June 8, 1941 – August 18, 2023)<ref name=amg/> was an American [[country music]] singer and guitarist.

==Biography==
He was born in [[Rogers, Arkansas]], United States.<ref name=amg/> Oxford was raised in [[Wichita, Kansas]], United States, where his father played old-time [[fiddle]].<ref name=amg/> He began playing professionally in [[Utah]] in 1960, mostly playing in the Kansas area in the early 1960s, then relocated to [[Nashville]] in 1964.<ref name=amg>{{Cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/vernon-oxford-mn0000270132/biography|title=Vernon Oxford | Biography & History|website=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=August 9, 2021}}</ref> In 1965, he met [[Harlan Howard]], who got him signed to [[RCA Victor]] and helped him find material to record.<ref name=amg/> He then released seven singles and one LP, ''Woman Let Me Sing You a Song''; none of them charted, and he was soon dropped from RCA.<ref name=amg/>

His career saw a resurgence in Britain, where he was first rediscovered in the middle of the 1970s.<ref name=amg/> A best-of was issued there in 1974, and RCA signed him again to tour there.<ref name=amg/> His hit singles "Shadows of My Mind", "Redneck (The Redneck National Anthem)", and "A Good Old Fashioned Saturday Night Honky Tonk Barroom Brawl" (U.S. Country No. 55, 1977) reinvigorated his career in America; in Britain, he was well known for "I've Got to Get Peter Off Your Mind" and "Field of Flowers".<ref name=amg/> He also recorded a comedy duet with [[Jim Ed Brown]], "Mowing The Lawn".<ref name="LarkinCountry">{{cite book|title=[[Encyclopedia of Popular Music|The Guinness Who's Who of Country Music]]|editor=[[Colin Larkin (writer)|Colin Larkin]]|publisher=[[Guinness Publishing]]|date=1993|edition=First|isbn=0-85112-726-6|page=305}}</ref> After a break of several years, he began a career as a [[gospel music|gospel]] singer in 1981.<ref name=amg/>

==Recording career==
Mostly as an independent artist, Oxford continued to record new material. Oxford's classic recordings have been reissued by numerous labels, including a comprehensive box set from [[Bear Family Records]], and some compilations from Westside UK and the Morello label, which is a division of UK-based [[Cherry Red Records]].

==Acting career==
As an actor, Oxford appeared in several films including ''[[The Thing Called Love]]'' starring [[River Phoenix]],<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.25thframe.co.uk/movies/index.php|title=The Thing Called Love|website=25thframe.co.uk|access-date=August 9, 2021}}</ref> and [[Coal Miner's Daughter (film)|''Coal Miner's Daughter'']], a 1980 film about American singer [[Loretta Lynn]], who was portrayed by actress [[Sissy Spacek]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://en.notrecinema.com/communaute/stars/stars.php3?staridx=212812|title=Welcome on notreCinema|website=En.notrecinema.com|access-date=August 9, 2021}}</ref>
